      • evaluate

        public int[] evaluate()
        Will return a number depending on the number of tokens a positive number means that there are more white tokens a black number int score[0] - who wins int score[1] - white int score[2] - black return the "score of the board."
        Specified by:
        evaluate in class GameConsoleInterface
        See Also:
        GameConsoleInterface.evaluate()

      • tokenChangeWithDirection

        private void tokenChangeWithDirection(int row,
                                      int col,
                                      int dir,
                                      PlayableItem player,
                                      int level)
        Parameters:
        row - the head of the line to be reversed
        col -
        dir - cardinal direction of where the line will be changed
        player - the color that the tokens will be flipped to
        level - the depth of the AI, used for the undoMove method if level is -1 then the move was made by a player

      • tokenChange

        private void tokenChange(int row,
                         int col,
                         PlayableItem player,
                         java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> changeSolution,
                         int level)
        Parameters:
        row - the value of where the a token has been added
        col -
        player - the color of the token being placed
        changeSolution - the array list of all the players available moves
        level - the level of the AI used to save the tokens to be changed

      • availableSolutions

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> availableSolutions(PlayableItem playerPiece)
        Parameters:
        playerPiece - is the color of the player that wants to check for his available moves
        Returns:
        an arrayList of all the valid moves for the player of playerPiece color the format of each string is has follows "row,col,dir" where row is the row value of the avaible move where col is the col value of the avaible move where dir is the directions where the its source for reversing the line is coming from it is possible for having strings with the same row and col but the direction will be different

      • isValid

        private boolean isValid(int row,
                        int col,
                        int c,
                        PlayableItem playerPiece)
        Parameters:
        row - of the adjacent space of the source token from availableSoltutions;
        col - " " " " " " " " " "
        c - if the cardinal direction of where the line is pointing from the source token
        if - the color of the player piece
        Returns:
        a boolean if the line is reversible
        See Also:
        availableSolutions(PlayableItem)

      • getAvailableSolutions

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAvailableSolutions(int player)
        Specified by:
        getAvailableSolutions in class GameConsoleInterface
        Parameters:
        player - an integer that defines the player that needs to see move usually 0 for the human 1 for the AI
        Returns:
        A list of moves that are available for the player to make, the list holds string in the following format "row,col,dir"(dir is used for Othello)
        See Also:
        GameConsoleInterface.getAvailableSolutions(int)

      • moveSet

        public boolean moveSet(int row,
                       int col,
                       int level)
        Specified by:
        moveSet in class GameConsoleInterface
        Parameters:
        row - a value that is used to know where the token is placed
        col - a value that is used to know where the token is placed
        level - the player that is making the move, usually even means it is a human uneven means it is the AI
        Returns:
        will return false if the row or col are out bounds or if the row or col tried and illegal move will be true otherwise
        See Also:
        GameConsoleInterface.moveSet(int, int, int)

      • undoMove

        public boolean undoMove(int row,
                        int col,
                        int level)
        Specified by:
        undoMove in class GameConsoleInterface
        Parameters:
        row - a value that is used to know where the token is removed
        col - a value that is used to know where the token is removed
        level - the player that is removing the move, usually: even means it is a human uneven means it is the AI
        Returns:
        will return false if the row or col are out bounds or if the row or col tried to remove a non-existing move will be true otherwise
        See Also:
        GameConsoleInterface.undoMove(int, int, int)
